thread.title: Windsor’s Cole Krantz tied for 3rd, Eaton in 5th after first day of state boys golf tournament
thread.title_full: Windsor’s Cole Krantz tied for 3rd, Eaton in 5th after first day of state boys golf tournament

author: TSPERRY
title: Windsor’s Cole Krantz tied for 3rd, Eaton in 5th after first day of state boys golf tournament
text: Monday Team Scores — Lakewood 219, Regis Jesuit 219, Fossil Ridge 221, Coronado 223, Mountain Vista 226. Top 5 individuals — Hunter Paugh (Fort Collins) 67, Griffin Barela (Lakewood) 71, A.J. Ott (Fort Collins) 71, Andrew McCormick (Regis Jesuit) 71, Austin Hardman (Mountain Vista) 71. Greeley West —Bryce Hoskins 91. Related Media Windsor junior Cole Krantz is tied for third place and Eaton’s team is in fifth after the first day of the Class 4A and Class 3A boys state golf tournaments. Krantz, joined by Windsor junior Sutton Hermann and Roosevelt’s Tyler Severin in the 4A tournament at Fox Hill Club in Longmont, shot an even 70 on Monday. Krantz is tied with Jackson Solem of Silver Creek for the third-place spot. Two Valor Christian golfers — Phillip Lee and Tim Amundson — occupy the No. 1 and No. 2 spots, respectively. Lee shot a 3-under 67, and Amundson shot a 1-under 69. Windsor’s Hermann shot an 87 and is tied for 68th. Roosevelt’s Severin is just ahead of him with an 86 and is tied for 64th. Krantz will tee off at 10:57 a.m. today on the front nine for the second day of stroke play. Severin will tee off at 10:12 a.m. on the back nine, followed by Hermann at 10:21 a.m. In the 3A tournament at Eagle Range Golf Course in Broomfield, Eaton is occupying 5th place as a team with a 29-over 245. Ahead of the Reds are Peak to Peak in first place (222), Kent Denver in second (232) and Basalt and Colorado Academy (tied at 243). Eaton is led by Ethan Alcazar, who is tied for 15th place with an 8-over 80. Joining him are Andy Geisick (tied for 22nd at 82), J.D. Truax (tied for 24th at 83) and Peter Grossenbacher (tied for 40th at 88). “We didn’t really play our best, but we hung in there,” said Eaton coach Gino Maio. “There were a few bad holes that kind of got each person on our team.” Alcazar will tee off at 10:51 a.m. today on the front nine. Geisick will tee off on the front nine at 10:24 a.m., and Truax will precede him at 10:15 a.m. Grossenbacher gets the first play of the day at 9:30 a.m. on the back nine. “It was a pretty decent round, so we’re encouraged,” Maio said. “Our goal is to at least get into third place, and we can do that by improving by two or three shots each. We’re just going to go out there and have fun, relax and put up some better scores.” In the 5A tournament, Greeley West’s Bryce Hoskins shot a 91 on Monday at Fort Collins Country Club. He will tee off at 10:27 a.m. today on the back nine.
